did.unittitle: [Unbound letters from Charles I, King of Great Britain (1600-1649), and from Edward Conway, 2nd Viscount Conway (1594-1655), written in the 1640's]

repository.corpname: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: For provenance information, consult the appropriate curator.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Osborn fb163 is the physical property of the Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University. Literary rights, including copyright, belong to the authors or their legal heirs and assigns. For further information, consult the appropriate curator.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Letters from King Charles I and Edward Conway. James Marshall and Marie-Louise Osborn Collection, Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This finding aid was produced from a previously existing list or card set. All pertinent bibliographical information has been retained; the volume may contain additional unlisted material.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The following finding aid is a complete inventory of the contents of Osborn fb163. This list was reformatted from previously existing cataloging.

did.unittitle: CHARLES I, KING OF GREAT BRITAIN, 1600-1649

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
[1645 Jan 2 - Apr 17]
6 p.
Autograph letters in the hand of
John Browne, Clerk of Parliament.
Concerning negotiations with and
preparations against Parliament to
Henrietta Maria, queen consort of
Charles I, 1609-1669.
folder 1.

did.unittitle: "Examination of my Lord Conway taken the 5th day of June 1644"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
2 p.
Scribal MS.
Regards his correspondence with the
Royalists, George Brydges, 6th baron
of Chandos (1620-1655) and Edward
Sackville, 7th earl of Dorset
(1590-1652). Witnessed by Algernon
Percy, 14th earl of Northumberland,
William Cecil, 16th earl of
Salisbury, William Grey, 1st baron
Grey, and William Fiennes, 1st
viscount of Saye and Sele.
folder 2.
